result.execSummary:
The defendant Briean R Vance was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $2,690.93 to be paid to Guardian Credit Union.  Joint and several with Cornell Prince Jr. 15CF2281

Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcahrges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
-Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving four (4) years Initial Confinement in this case.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with victims Debra P., Andrea B., Guardian Credit Union and the coactors:  Sincerae Trimble, Cornell Prince Jr.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.

Submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that hemay never again possess firearms/body armor or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Briean R Vance

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Briean R Vance in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Briean R Vance in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 10 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 5 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victims:  Debra P., Andrea B., Guardian Credit Union and the co-actors:  Sincerae Trimble, Cornell Prince Jr.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $2690.93 to be paid to Guardian Credit Union,  joint and several with Cornell Prince Jr. 15CF2281.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armour or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 4 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Briean R Vance in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Briean R Vance in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms/body armour warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Any restitution will be determined at sentencing.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Briean R Vance not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea hearing .  Court is in trial.   Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection received and filed.
Per defense request for substitution against Judge Conen (post-rotation) filed by defense.
against Judge Conen (post-rotation) filed by defense.  The newly assigned court is Judge Pocan's Court.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Briean R Vance not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties still under negotiations, therefore, request an adjournment.
Court GRANTS request.
  
ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Defense filed a request for substitution today.
The newly assigned court is Judge Pocan's Court.

Case adjourned to 09-09-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 26, Judge Pocan's Court.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING  commencing JUNE 02. 2015 received and filed. (21 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to THOMAS HARRIS 20935 SWANSON AVE #360 WAUKESHA WI 53045.

Defendant Briean R Vance in court IN CUSTODY with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

Case adjourned to 07-02-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea Hearing.
Original Information filed by ADA Catelin Ringersma on behalf of the State.

Defendant Briean R Vance in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Briean R Vance in custody.  Ronald Dague for Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Defense Counsel requests sequestration of all State's witnesses.  Sworn for the state:Shaundra Randolph-Village of West Milwaukee Police Department Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State is requesting an Arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Arraignment scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANDREA B., DEBRA P., AND GUARANTEE CREDIT UNION, 4501 W GREENFIELD AVENUE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Briean R Vance in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Briean R Vance in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
